text:
When I evaluate the return code of the -t option, to decide in a bash script whether I should restart the web server or not the return code is always 0, no matter whether the config is correct or not.

Regarding to the manpage this option should result in 0 when there's no error in the config, otherwise it should result in 1.

With httpd 2.2 it works like expected, with 2.4.1 not.
It looks like the bug is created by an patch I forgot to remove from SPEC file. When I compile the httpd manually the error doesn't appear anymore. Sorry for the inconvenience!
